pageContext.claim: “Omar, you take a look at her back-tweets and her back-statements what she says about Israel, what she says about Jewish people. If anybody ever said that about somebody else it would be -- and by the way -- unthinkable to hear it because if you go back even five years it would be unthinkable to say it.”
pageContext.analysis: Rep. Ilhan Omar (D-Minn.), a Muslim member of Congress, has made some controversial comments about Israel and American Jewish support for it, but Trump goes too far to say they are "unthinkable." Some of her comments have been taken out of context by political opponents; others she has apologized for. Trump himself has made remarks about Jews that some have said are at least tone-deaf, if not anti-Semitic.
